moves.1. d4: Welcome readers, the purpose of this annotation isn't to "show how good I am" or to brag about beating an opponent with a rating 600 points south of mine. Mostly I just liked the look of the final picture, and wanted to share it. Hope you enjoy!
moves.1... Nf6 2. Nd2: Looks a bit odd, but seems playable.
moves.2... d5 3. e3 Bf5: Nothing very unusual yet, just developing. Is this a London style defense perhaps?
moves.4. Ne2: Now it looks a bit odd by White. The knights exert interesting pressure on the centre, but severely impede eveything else.
moves.5. f4 c5: I always like to move the c-pawn before the knight if I can.
moves.6. dxc5 Bxc5: Development looks good so far. Threatening the e3 pawn.
moves.7... Bxe3 8. Qb3: Forking the bishop and the b pawn.
moves.8... Ng4: 8...Bb6 seemed a natural way to defend both threats, but the text move defends the bishop, and sets the scene.
moves.9. Qxb7: The free pawn was just too irresistable...
moves.9... Bf2+: With the bishops effectively out of play, and the queen off on a pawn grabbing sortie there is no escape.
moves.10... Ne3#: And a very attractive mate don't you think? Thanks for reading! All comments welcome.

gameName: Short game with a pretty mate
